channel.title: Messed up something with Super User
channel.description:
Well, I changed the folder Var to where I can edit it without being in Super User, so I could change files in the www apache folder under /var/www/ how am I to change this :| I can't do anything in Sudo now because of this. sudo: /var/run/sudo/kloplop owned by uid 1000, should be uid 0
help please... also, where is the apache configuration file?
secondly, why do I get this error on my computer but not on my website?
Fatal error: Cannot use object of type stdClass as array in /var/www/function.php on line 15 (the odd thing is on line 15 it is only [php]if ($info['suspended'] == "Yes"){[/php] :( )

item.title: Messed up something with Super User
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I got somebody to help me on IRC on #kubuntu to help me, I just had to restart

Read full topic
item.source: Messed up something with Super User

item.title: Messed up something with Super User
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Ok, go in a normal user where the id is 1000, set the permissions to all… And revert what you did.

Read full topic
item.source: Messed up something with Super User

item.title: Messed up something with Super User
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

Well, I changed the folder Var to where I can edit it without being in Super User, so I could change files in the www apache folder under /var/www/
how am I to change this
I can’t do anything in Sudo now because of this.
sudo: /var/run/sudo/kloplop owned by uid 1000, should be uid 0

help please… also, where is the apache configuration file?

secondly, why do I get this error on my computer but not on my website?

Fatal error: Cannot use object of type stdClass as array in /var/www/function.php on line 15
(the odd thing is on line 15 it is only [php]if ($info[‘suspended’] == “Yes”){[/php] )

Read full topic
item.source: Messed up something with Super User
